episode_title: 415 - The One With All The Rugby

content.description: A beauty parlour, Rachel is getting a manicure while Chandler, yes Chandler, is getting a petticure (Does that scare you that I know those terms? Well, it scares me.).

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I can’t believe I’m getting my nails done! And you said it was gonna be fun! (pause) Which it kinda is. Also, you said there would be other guys here. There are no other guys here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, there’s a guy right over there. (Points to the counter)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a mailman! That’s our mailman! (Waves to the mailman) (Sarcastic) Hi. How are ya?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler, don’t worry! This doesn’t make you any less of a guy! (Chandler starts blowing on his fingernails like women do.) That does! (Chandler stops blowing.) What am I sitting on? (She looks and finds a huge nail.) I hate to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: OH…MY…GAWD!! (Yep, you guessed it. It’s Janice.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel and Joey are standing at the counter. Monica is flipping a light switch on and off next to the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, Nothing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Didn’t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it did?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know what it did! Nothing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They wouldn’t have put it there if it didn’t do something! How can you not care?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like this. (Shrugs)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, here’s another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that silver knob on the toilet does?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! It flushes it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind actually using it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Sees Janice.) Ah!! (Janice screams in surprise.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Guess who we ran into today?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Janice?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Isn’t this amazing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How have you been?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh well, I’m divorced.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh, wow.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Yeah, I’m riding the alimony pony. (Does the now famous laugh.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And there it is.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I just came up to say, “Hi!” Hi! (to Chandler) And you, sweetie, I’ll see you tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Bye.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: B-bye!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Bye-bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye. (Finally closes the door on her.) (After it’s closed) I can’t stand the woman! (Phoebe is shocked, Joey is relieved.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! I thought you were crazy about her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before we fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personality—Well, they’re all back! Y’know? And she’s picked up like nine new ones!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what are you doing bringing her here?! There’s people here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t worry about it. I’m taking care of it tonight. (Chandler opens the fridge and grabs something to drink.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are not. You have never been able to break up with her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t have to break up with her this time. We’re not involved! I’m going to do a pre-emptive strike! I’m going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen! (Closes the fridge.)
content.parenthetical: standing in the door of the fridge

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes. (They all look around and then back at Joey.) I’m tellin’ ya!

content.description: A street, Ross and Emily are walking home from a date.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I can’t believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such stories about New York.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly safe.
(At that moment two very large men start screaming and running towards Emily and picking her up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Help! Help!! Help! Help!!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home. (Introducing them) Liam, Devon, this is Ross.

content.speaker: Devon
content.text: Hey, mate.

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: How are ya man?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, that was a good one, huh? (Imitating himself) Help! Help!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: So how are you? I’ve been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived but umm, well, I’ve been rather busy.

content.speaker: Devon
content.text: Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that U2 concert?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh my God. I think you’re right.

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: Well, actually the last time you and I saw each other was that morning.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, Liam. (Ross laughs and takes her back.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or something—or should I call it (In an English accent) football?

content.speaker: Devon
content.text: We were playing rugby.

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: In fact we’re playing a game at the park tomorrow. You’re welcome to play too if you want.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross play rugby? I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s ah, what’s so funny about that?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well I mean, you’re American to start with. You don’t even have rugby here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we didn’t have freedom here until 1776, either so…

content.speaker: Devon
content.text: So good then! We’ll see you at Riverside Park at 2:00! Cheers!

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: Cheers!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Cheers!
(Liam and Devon both take a swig of their beers, while Ross takes a swig of his coffee. The Brits both crush their cans, and not to be out done, Ross crushes his coffee cup, spilling its contents.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is attempting his pre-emptive strike.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh boy, I just love to sing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were complaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River .

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, look at us! Who would’ve thought that Cupid had a station at 14th Street Nails. (Does the laugh)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, we have to talk. I’m just getting out of a very serious relationship…

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I know! And I’m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about meant to be!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away this time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hear ya. (Pause) But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me overseas!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh no! Where to? (Gasps) Too Paris?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! Not, Paris.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? (Thinks) Yemen. That’s right, yes, I’m being transferred to Yemen!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: When?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know exactly.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until that moment comes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But I do know that it’s some time tomorrow.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Monica are plugging in a bunch of electronics.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Done?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and checked every outlet. Now, four of them don’t work. Which means, one of them has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out which one it is.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I bet I stopped listening before you did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, you-you also could’ve used uh, lamps and then followed the light.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well, I’m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody ready? Here we go. (She flips on the switch and a hum starts.) I hear something! I hear something! Where is it? (They all start looking until Rachel realises it’s Joey.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s coming from Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, that’s so freaky! Turn him off!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are watching rugby on TV as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, just hold on a second. I’m watching this rugby thing on ESPN . I don’t know what the big deal is. I’m man enough to play this sport.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, you’re not even man enough to order the channel that carries the sport.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Hey there Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Janice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know uh, you didn’t really have to help me pack.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and the time you leave is packing, you didn’t really leave me much choice. Did you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did not !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m packing. Y’know I’m-I’m packing ‘cause I’m moving to Yemen tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks for telling me!
(Janice runs into the bedroom.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m only going to pretend I’m moving to Yemen, it’s the only way I can get rid off her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Chandler! Come on, I’m gonna show how to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It’s a real space saver.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know, I do that ‘cause it makes me look taller.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay, Chandler, come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (to Joey) Joey, trade lives with me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope. (To Ross) Man look at this! Ross, I can’t believe you said you’d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I can handle it! All right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s ‘cause-‘cause you’re mom’s dog kept-kept looking at me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here. That’s called a scrum, okay? It’s kinda like a huddle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross! (Laughs) They’re gonna kill you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, why are you doing this anyway?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you should’ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I mean, he’s like Joe Rugby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That’s so funny. (Realises) Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was like hilarious. So I’m gonna show her how tough I really am!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. You’re right, you are a tough guy. You’re the toughest palaeontologist I know.
content.parenthetical: starts laughing, Ross stares at her

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It’s not like he’s…Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, don’t worry about me. Okay? I’ll just stay real energetic and stay away from the ball. I’ll uh, I’ll be that guy right out of the circle. (He points to a player who starts running and then gets viscously tackled from behind.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin’ at him.
(Ross turns and wants to attack Rachel, but Joey stops him.)

content.description: The park, everyone is warming up for the rugby game. Only Joey and Phoebe came to support Ross.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy (Points), and that guy (Points). And that one—Dude! They’re all huge!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They don’t look any bigger than me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, maybe that’s because you’re closer to you. So you look bigger to you from where you are.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I’m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Okay. (Goes to say hi to the lads.)
(A player comes over and picks up a ball in front of Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.
(The player stands up and smiles. Showing that he has no front teeth.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa! (The player leaves and to Joey) I kinda liked it.
(The referee blows the whistle and the players gather to start the game.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I know what I have to do. I’ve got to go Red Ross. (Joey and Phoebe don’t know what he’s talking about.) Y’know, Red Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I totally don’t know what you’re talking about.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all red! Red Ross!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’ll see.
[Cut to Emily, Devon, and Liam]

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it’s his first time.

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: You don’t say! (We see Ross who is hopping about with the ball and spikes it in his face.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Good luck, babe.
(The scrum forms and the game is underway.)

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here! (Ross gets pumped up.) Ross! Come on!
(Ross walks over to the scrum, walks around a bit looking for a way to get into the scrum.)

content.speaker: Liam
content.text: Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!
(Ross, urged on by his team-mates, jumps on top of the scrum and falls headfirst into the middle, leaving his feet sticking straight up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey!!!!!!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is going over some plans as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You…are…not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today, and guess what happened?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He asked you out?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Saucy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are these?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Electrical plans for the building.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! If only more people knew.

content.description: The airport, the Yemen Express counter, Chandler is still trying to get rid of Janice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know you, really didn’t have to take me to the airport.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh please. Every moment is precious. Y’know? Besides, somebody had to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don’t really seem to care too much that you’re leaving.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, we’re really not that close. (Pause) Okay, so I guess this is uh, good-bye then.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: On no! No! It’s not good-bye, I’m not leaving until you get on that plane.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Then I guess it’s just, wait here then. (Hands her the sign that says, Wait Here.”) (To the ticket agent) Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.

content.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
content.text: One ticket to Yemen?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.

content.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
content.text: I’m sorry sir, I don’t understand.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?

content.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
content.text: Are you travelling with a child?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. All right, y’know what, she’s (Points to Janice) gonna think that I’m handing you a credit card, but what I’m really gonna do is hand you a library card.

content.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
content.text: Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don’t take library cards.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: What’s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: American Express ?

content.description: The rugby game, Ross is getting killed.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I can’t believe they’re doing that to him! I told them to go easy on him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No offence but, y’know sometimes it’s hard to understand you, y’know with the accent, so…
(The whistle blows.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: That’s just halftime, there’s more of this.
(Ross limps over all covered in mud.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle of water?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. (When she’s gone he collapses into Joey.) I-I think I’m dying. I really do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, poor baby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Tell my son that I love him. (Emily returns with the water.) Excellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ross, they are killing you out there!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not true!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s right! You have to stop!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? No! No, I’m not stopping. I’m Red Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, if you go back out there, you’re gonna be Dead Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: No. That’s not what I’m saying. I just may know a few things that might help you inflict some pain.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like that.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: One swift kick and he’ll back off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, bad ankle, got it!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh, and David over there, I heard he doesn’t wear a cup.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: And uh, Liam, Liam’s got bad knees. You hit him right and he’ll go down like a lamp.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But-but, Liam’s on my team.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I don’t care! You just get him!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in! (Squeals like a madman.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Red Ross! Okay.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is reading a book as Rachel returns.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What-what are-what are these?
content.parenthetical: noticing a bunch of pictures around the door that weren’t there originally.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they’d brighten up the place. They do don’t you think?
(Rachel rips one of the wall and finds a huge hole underneath.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no, no!
(Rachel rips off another one, revealing another hole. Rachel then moves onto a third one, but this one doesn’t have a hole underneath it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know that there’s no hole there, I just really liked that picture.
(Rachel looks at it and then throws it away. She then removes a fourth one, revealing a third hole.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Look at this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care! The wires have come loose in your head!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And did you?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.
(Rachel removes a paper on the floor which is covering a hole and gasps.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But it didn’t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Mrs. Chatracus
content.text: Hello darling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.

content.description: Central Perk, They are returning from the rugby game, Joey and Emily are carrying Ross.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Now, are you sure you don’t want to go see a doctor?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no! That-that’ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I was great! This is a great day! Y’know what? I’m buying everyone coffee. All right? If someone would just grab my wallet, it’s in my pocket.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, not you. (Emily gets it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, look, your eye’s still popping out a little, I’m gonna go get some ice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice! (They go and get the coffee and the ice leaving Ross and Emily alone.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You were amazing out there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I kinda was, wasn’t I?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven’t done that since I was four and I washed my dad’s Porsche with rocks.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You really enjoyed yourself didn’t you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody nose—I mean I-I’m not proud of it but, I really am. And it’s all because of you, wonderful, amazing you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I think you’ve got concussion.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, I’m serious. Thank you.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You’re welcome. (She hugs him tightly and he winces.) I’m sorry. Did I hurt you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s worth the pain. (She goes to hug him again.) Y’know what, you know what? It’s not.

content.description: The airport, the flight to Yemen is being called.

content.speaker: Ticket Counter Attendant
content.text: This is the final boarding call for Flight 664 to Yemen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I-I guess I gotta go.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I’ll wait for you. Do you even know how long you’re going to be gone?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh. Well, I’ll right you everyday. (Reading the address) 15 Yemen Road, Yemen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, good-bye. Good-bye.
(He gives the agent his ticket and walks onto the jetway. Janice walks over and looks out the window. Chandler walks back into the terminal and tries to walk right past Janice, but she sees him.)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: No! No! I wanna see you take-off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I then guess I’m going to Yemen! I’m going to Yemen! (To this old woman also going to Yemen.) When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica has finally given up on her search to find what the light switch does and is now flicking it on and off aimlessly.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right. The super couldn’t figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldn’t figure out what it did. I’ve had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank God.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.

[Cut to Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Phoebe are watching TV. The TV is turning off and on, and each time Phoebe is blinking her eyes like the Genie did. The switch obviously controls the outlet which the TV is plugged into.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See? I’m doing it. I am totally doing it. (Suddenly it stops working.) I lost it.
